io.atomix.catalyst.buffer

Class MappedBytes

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.catalyst.buffer.AbstractBytes
      • io.atomix.catalyst.buffer.NativeBytes
        • io.atomix.catalyst.buffer.MappedBytes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bytes, BytesInput<Bytes>, BytesOutput<Bytes>, AutoCloseable

    public class MappedBytes
extends NativeBytes
    Mapped bytes.

    Mapped bytes provide direct access to memory from allocated by a MappedByteBuffer. Memory is allocated by opening and expanding the given File to the desired count and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

    Closing the bytes via Bytes.close() will result in BytesOutput.flush() being automatically called.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        public static MappedBytes allocate(File file,
                                   long size)
        Allocates a mapped buffer in FileChannel.MapMode.READ_WRITE mode.

        Memory will be mapped by opening and expanding the given File to the desired count and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

        Parameters:
        file - The file to map into memory. If the file doesn't exist it will be automatically created.
        size - The count of the buffer to allocate (in bytes).
        Returns:
        The mapped buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If file is null
        IllegalArgumentException - If count is greater than MappedMemory.MAX_SIZE
        See Also:
        allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long)

      • allocate

        public static MappedBytes allocate(File file,
                                   FileChannel.MapMode mode,
                                   long size)
        Allocates a mapped buffer.

        Memory will be mapped by opening and expanding the given File to the desired count and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

        Parameters:
        file - The file to map into memory. If the file doesn't exist it will be automatically created.
        mode - The mode with which to map the file.
        size - The count of the buffer to allocate (in bytes).
        Returns:
        The mapped buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If file is null
        IllegalArgumentException - If count is greater than MappedMemory.MAX_SIZE
        See Also:
        allocate(java.io.File, long)
